member.name: T:System.Drawing.DdsFile
member.summary: Represents an image encoded using one of the supported DDS mechanisms.
member.remarks:
A "DirectX Draw Surface" stores compressed pixel data that is used when rendering scenes. The pixel data may be used for purposes other than purely display, such as being used for masked operations on another DDS image.
Note that this assembly depends on two unmanaged libraries:
squishinterface_Win32.dll - code for 32bit Windows systems.
squishinterface_x64.dll - code for 64bit Windows systems.

member.name: M:System.Drawing.DdsFile.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Creates an image of a single colour, specified by the byte parameters, with the size given by the int parameters. If is true, also creates an HSVa-encoded version of the image.

Amount of alpha per pixel.
Width of image.
Height of image.

member.name: M:System.Drawing.DdsFile.CreateImage(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an image of a single colour, specified by the uint parameter (low byte is "blue", then "green", then "red" then high byte is "alpha"), with the size given by the int parameters. If is true, also creates an HSVa-encoded version of the image.
member.param: Colour of image (low byte is "blue", then "green", then "red" then high byte is "alpha").
Width of image.
Height of image.

member.name: M:System.Drawing.DdsFile.SetAlphaFromGreyscale(System.Drawing.DdsFile)
member.summary: Converts the R, G and B channels of the supplied to greyscale and loads this into the Alpha channel of the current image. The image format will be changed to one supporting an 8-bit Alpha channel, if required.
member.param: to extract greyscale data from for alpha channel.

member.name: M:System.Drawing.DdsFile.SetAlphaFromGreyscale(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Converts the R, G and B channels of the supplied to greyscale and loads this into the Alpha channel of the current image.

member.summary: Converts the R, G and B channels of the supplied to greyscale and loads this into the Alpha channel of the current image. The image format will be changed to one supporting an Alpha channel, if required.
member.param: to extract greyscale data from for alpha channel.

member.summary: Set the image format to one without an alpha channel, clearing the alpha data.

member.name: M:System.Drawing.DdsFile.GetGreyscaleFromAlpha
member.summary: Get a greyscale image representing the alpha channel of the current image.

member.name: M:System.Drawing.DdsFile.GetImage(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extract a representing the current image, subject to the filtering requested.
member.param: When true, the red channel of the DDS contributes to the red pixels of the returned image.
When true, the green channel of the DDS contributes to the green pixels of the returned image.
When true, the blue channel of the DDS contributes to the blue pixels of the returned image.
When true, the alpha channel of the DDS contributes to the pixel transparency in the returned image.
When true, the alpha channel of the DDS is inverted.
member.returns: A representation of the DDS encoded image in the loaded .

member.name: P:System.Drawing.DdsFile.Size
member.summary: The image size.

member.name: P:System.Drawing.DdsFile.UseDXT
member.summary: If true, use DXT-type image compression for storage. The exact format will depend on the . By default, DXT5 will be used. Setting to false (from true) will default to A8B8G8R8 format.

member.name: P:System.Drawing.DdsFile.UseLuminance
member.summary: If true, treat the image as a luminance (plus alpha) map for storage. Currently only A8L8, 16bit coding is supported. Setting to false (from true) will default to A8B8G8R8 (non-DXT) format.

member.name: P:System.Drawing.DdsFile.AlphaDepth
member.summary: When UseDXT is true, the DXT compression mode. Otherwise the number of bits per alpha pixel.
member.remarks: Value is used when saving a DDS. Invalid values may cause exceptions at that point.

member.name: P:System.Drawing.DdsFile.Image
member.summary: The current image.

member.name: P:System.Drawing.DdsFile.HSVShift
member.summary: The HSVShift applied to the current image, when supported.

member.name: P:System.Drawing.DdsFile.SupportsHSV
member.summary: True if the image is prepared to process HSV requests.

member.returns: True if the channel is active, otherwise false.

member.summary: When true, the image will resize to the control bounds.

member.summary: When non-zero, indicates the maximum width and height to constrain the image size.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.Channel1
member.summary: The "Red" checkbox Checked state.
member.remarks: The DDS Image is retrieved using the Channel1 to 4 and InvertCh4 values.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.Channel2
member.summary: The "Green" checkbox Checked state.
member.remarks: The DDS Image is retrieved using the Channel1 to 4 and InvertCh4 values.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.Channel3
member.summary: The "Blue" checkbox Checked state.
member.remarks: The DDS Image is retrieved using the Channel1 to 4 and InvertCh4 values.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.Channel4
member.summary: The "Alpha" checkbox Checked state.
member.remarks: The DDS Image is retrieved using the Channel1 to 4 and InvertCh4 values.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.InvertCh4
member.summary: The "Invert" checkbox Checked state.
member.remarks: The DDS Image is retrieved using the Channel1 to 4 and InvertCh4 values.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.ShowChannelSelector
member.summary: When true, the Channel Selection checkboxes will be displayed above the image.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.SupportsHSV
member.summary: When true, enables use of HSV-related methods.
member.remarks: Requires an increase in stored data whilst true.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.HueShift
member.summary: Hue shift to be applied to the image.
member.remarks: Only effective when HSV processing is enabled.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.SaturationShift
member.summary: Saturation shift to be applied to the image.
member.remarks: Only effective when HSV processing is enabled.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.ValueShift
member.summary: Value shift to be applied to the image.
member.remarks: Only effective when HSV processing is enabled.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.Image
member.summary: Returns the image that is displayed by the DDSPanel.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.ImageSize
member.summary: The size of the current image (or if not loaded).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.AlphaDepth
member.summary: The number of alpha channel bits per pixel in the encoded DDS image or the DXT compression mode.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.UseDXT
member.summary: If true, use DXT-type image compression for storage. The mode will depend on the .
member.remarks: Setting to false (from true) will default to A8B8G8R8 format.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.UseLuminance
member.summary: If true, treat the image as a luminance (plus alpha) map for storage.
member.remarks: Currently only A8L8, 16bit coding is supported. Setting to false (from true) will default to A8B8G8R8 (non-DXT) format. Setting to true does not turn the image into a greyscale. This only happens on saving the image (and will not affect the displayed values until they are read back in).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.MaskLoaded
member.summary: Indicates that a Mask is currently loaded.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.DDSPanel.MaskSize
member.summary: The size of the current mask (or if no mask loaded).

member.name: M:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.CompressImage(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags,System.Single[])
member.summary: Compresses an image in memory.
member.param: The pixels of the source.
The width of the source image.
The height of the source image.
Compression flags.
An optional perceptual metric.
member.returns: Byte array containing the compressed output.

remarks.para: The source pixels should be presented as a contiguous array of width*height rgba values, with each component as 1 byte each. In memory this should be: { r1, g1, b1, a1, .... , rn, gn, bn, an } for n = width*height

The parameter should specify either kDxt1, kDxt3 or kDxt5 compression, however, DXT1 will be used by default if none is specified. When using DXT1 compression, 8 bytes of storage are required for each compressed DXT block. DXT3 and DXT5 compression require 16 bytes of storage per block.

The parameter can also specify a preferred colour compressor to use when fitting the RGB components of the data. Possible colour compressors are: kColourClusterFit (the default), kColourRangeFit (very fast, low quality) or kColourIterativeClusterFit (slowest, best quality).

When using kColourClusterFit or kColourIterativeClusterFit, an additional flag can be specified to weight the importance of each pixel by its alpha value. For images that are rendered using alpha blending, this can significantly increase the perceived quality.

The parameter can be used to weight the relative importance of each colour channel, or pass NULL to use the default uniform weight of { 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f }. This replaces the previous flag-based control that allowed either uniform or "perceptual" weights with the fixed values { 0.2126f, 0.7152f, 0.0722f }. If non-NULL, the metric should point to a contiguous array of 3 floats.

member.name: M:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.DecompressImage(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags)
member.summary: Decompresses an image in memory.
member.param: The compressed DXT blocks.
The width of the source image.
The height of the source image.
Compression flags.
member.returns: Byte array containing the decompressed pixels.
member.remarks: The decompressed pixels will be written as a contiguous array of width*height 16 rgba values, with each component as 1 byte each. In memory this is: { r1, g1, b1, a1, .... , rn, gn, bn, an } for n = width*height The parameter should specify either kDxt1, kDxt3 or kDxt5 compression, however, DXT1 will be used by default if none is specified. All other flags are ignored.

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kDxt1
member.summary: Use DXT1 compression.

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kDxt3
member.summary: Use DXT3 compression.

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kDxt5
member.summary: Use DXT5 compression.

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kColourClusterFit
member.summary: Use a slow but high quality colour compressor (the default).

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kColourRangeFit
member.summary: Use a fast but low quality colour compressor.

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kColourMetricPerceptual
member.summary: Use a perceptual metric for colour error (the default).

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kColourMetricUniform
member.summary: Use a uniform metric for colour error.

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kWeightColourByAlpha
member.summary: Weight the colour by alpha during cluster fit (disabled by default).

member.name: F:System.Drawing.DdsSquish.SquishFlags.kColourIterativeClusterFit
member.summary: Use a very slow but very high quality colour compressor.

member.name: T:System.Drawing.ColorHSVA
member.summary: Implement ColorHSVA class and conversion to ColorRGBA
member.remarks: See this paper for where this code originates. Note that I've changed disagreements between scaling by 255 or 256 to always use 255. This means floats range from 0.0f to 1.0f and bytes from 0 to 255. I hope.
